snippet.textDisplay:
I love SoT so much but Ik, no matter how much they update it, it won’t have the longevity that the team want it to have as there is no real progress as everything is cosmetic. Imo, there needs to be a TF2 style system, where you can spend gold for “upgrades” that won’t be too overpowering so that noob players can fight. To clarify, every upgrade would have a buff and debuff so that they offer a specific play style and adds diversity but are well balanced, reminiscent of TF2’s weapon system and there’s nothing to stop them doing this with weapons as well. It would give players something to work towards while making sure the base ships are still the best all round.
Also, not to push it, but it would be nice if you could upgrade ur starting barrel supplies so that crews don’t have to waste half hour grabbing all the supplies from an outpost as well as maybe a row boat. Still tho, love the game, been playing since beta, well done team!
snippet.textOriginal:
I love SoT so much but Ik, no matter how much they update it, it won’t have the longevity that the team want it to have as there is no real progress as everything is cosmetic. Imo, there needs to be a TF2 style system, where you can spend gold for “upgrades” that won’t be too overpowering so that noob players can fight. To clarify, every upgrade would have a buff and debuff so that they offer a specific play style and adds diversity but are well balanced, reminiscent of TF2’s weapon system and there’s nothing to stop them doing this with weapons as well. It would give players something to work towards while making sure the base ships are still the best all round.
Also, not to push it, but it would be nice if you could upgrade ur starting barrel supplies so that crews don’t have to waste half hour grabbing all the supplies from an outpost as well as maybe a row boat. Still tho, love the game, been playing since beta, well done team!

snippet.textDisplay: Don't get me wrong when I say this. I absolutely love this idea, but this is really worrysome to me because Adventure mode has enough hostile players as it is now. I thought arena would help, but it didn't and I don't think this will help any either. I can't truly complain though because it's a pirate game. Theres gonna be fighting every once in a while and I love that wholeheartedly, but it's been getting really hard to just relax and enjoy the game without being messed with by other players. Aside from that, I love the asthetics of everything being added and I'm glad to see our furry feline friends finally join our crews. Bless you guys and all the wonderful work you've put into this game over the past couple years! :) <3
snippet.textOriginal: Don't get me wrong when I say this. I absolutely love this idea, but this is really worrysome to me because Adventure mode has enough hostile players as it is now. I thought arena would help, but it didn't and I don't think this will help any either. I can't truly complain though because it's a pirate game. Theres gonna be fighting every once in a while and I love that wholeheartedly, but it's been getting really hard to just relax and enjoy the game without being messed with by other players. Aside from that, I love the asthetics of everything being added and I'm glad to see our furry feline friends finally join our crews. Bless you guys and all the wonderful work you've put into this game over the past couple years! :) <3

snippet.textDisplay:
Un gioco che poteva diventare un capolavoro ma rovinato da aggiornamenti stupidi per bimbi: ti spari col cannone senza farti male, palle maledette trovabili ovunque, esche trovabili ovunque, missioni principali rimaste invariate dalla beta, sei leggenda pirata ma il gioco continua a darti teschi schifosi e altra robaccia, sei leggenda pirata e non puoi mettere delle missioni speciali del Mercante o delle Anime o dei Tesori perchè non esiste niente, non puoi entrare in Avventura e farti una partita PVE perchè la gente ti bombarda lo stesso, etc, etc, etc, etc.
Ma soprattutto, soprattutto, non c'è una guida di tutte le missioni e le storie all'interno del gioco. Uno entra nella partita e si ritrova confuso.
Inoltre non ci sono degli obiettivi reali, non è possibile completare le onorificenze e non ti danno neanche dei bonus se le completi.
Le isole sono abbastanza fatte male, roba che neanche in un universo parallelo esistono delle isole così irrealistiche.
Aspettando Sea of Thieves 2
snippet.textOriginal:
Un gioco che poteva diventare un capolavoro ma rovinato da aggiornamenti stupidi per bimbi: ti spari col cannone senza farti male, palle maledette trovabili ovunque, esche trovabili ovunque, missioni principali rimaste invariate dalla beta, sei leggenda pirata ma il gioco continua a darti teschi schifosi e altra robaccia, sei leggenda pirata e non puoi mettere delle missioni speciali del Mercante o delle Anime o dei Tesori perchè non esiste niente, non puoi entrare in Avventura e farti una partita PVE perchè la gente ti bombarda lo stesso, etc, etc, etc, etc.
Ma soprattutto, soprattutto, non c'è una guida di tutte le missioni e le storie all'interno del gioco. Uno entra nella partita e si ritrova confuso. 
Inoltre non ci sono degli obiettivi reali, non è possibile completare le onorificenze e non ti danno neanche dei bonus se le completi. 
Le isole sono abbastanza fatte male, roba che neanche in un universo parallelo esistono delle isole così irrealistiche.
Aspettando Sea of Thieves 2

snippet.textDisplay:
Will we ever see items that differ from others in ways that are not only cosmetic? If weapons had different stats and cost more for better weapons that would be a lot of fun. Some ideas are:
Different gun stats, ship hull armor, body armor, canon upgrades, a wing-suit that could deploy after firing yourself out of a canon.

I think it would also be very cool if ship crews could claim islands as their territory which would increase their crew reputation. Claiming different islands would give you a unique perk in some way of the game. Your claimed islands stay yours until another ship sinks you, at which time the islands reset and can be claimed again by anyone.
snippet.textOriginal:
Will we ever see items that differ from others in ways that are not only cosmetic? If weapons had different stats and cost more for better weapons that would be a lot of fun. Some ideas are: 
Different gun stats, ship hull armor, body armor, canon upgrades, a wing-suit that could deploy after firing yourself out of a canon. 

I think it would also be very cool if ship crews could claim islands as their territory which would increase their crew reputation. Claiming different islands would give you a unique perk in some way of the game. Your claimed islands stay yours until another ship sinks you, at which time the islands reset and can be claimed again by anyone.

snippet.textDisplay: Fix. Your. Game. For the second time this game screws us over, we we sold a bunch of loot but not all of it, and a player brigantine comes in. The catch? Get 2 skeleton galleons spawned on us, on top of a megolodon which automatically was attacking us. Not in a fleet, the fort was active nearby. They were a horribly skilled crew but the damages from the 2 ghost ships and megs were too much to keep up with. Explain.
snippet.textOriginal: Fix. Your. Game. For the second time this game screws us over, we we sold a bunch of loot but not all of it, and a player brigantine comes in. The catch? Get 2 skeleton galleons spawned on us, on top of a megolodon which automatically was attacking us. Not in a fleet, the fort was active nearby. They were a horribly skilled crew but the damages from the 2 ghost ships and megs were too much to keep up with. Explain.

snippet.textDisplay:
Changes to open world seem great. World PvP is looking very tasty right now.

However, as someone who mainly plays sloop arena, the arena changes will do more harm than good. My criticism comes out of love for this game.

Having one chest and one outpost will lead to one thing, and one thing only. More outpost camping. Outpost camping is currently a high risk high reward strategy. If no one comes to your outpost, you get no points. Now it's just a high reward strategy. Ironically, this will also reduce the amount of combat (which I think is what the devs are going for here.)

If I was to go to the island, I wouldn't go for the chest. I will probably get more points from shooting the ship of a team who went for it. The chest then becomes redundant. If you want people to just fight, remove the chests. Make it a deathmatch. This will however ruin the feel of what makes Sea of Thieves so great.

The reason the current system is actually very good is because you have to make value-judgements on:

a) What island you go to - high chest concentration (more money) or low chest concentration (more safety)
b) Where you sell your chests - avoiding combat or being in an aggressive/looting position.
c) Your late game strategy: looking for more chests or sinking competitors to stay in the lead.
As you can see, there is a lot of choice overall. There are many ways to approach getting points.

The new value judgements become:

a) Do I go to the island, or camp outpost?
b) If I go to the island, do I try and get the chest or hit ships?
I think in most cases, you will either: camp outpost, or hit ships. This ultimately reduces player choice. The chest is a massively high risk strategy, now that everyone can see it. Maybe if you could not see the chest, this could make things more interesting.

In my opinion, having to make more value-judgements improves the depth and richness of the arena mode.

So, what's the fix?

Option A) Keep two outposts.

This makes outpost camping less viable, and incentivises players to go for the chest, or at least the island where the chest is. There is a massive sunk cost in outpost camping - if the ship with the chest avoids you, you get nothing. This makes it much more likely that ships will get involved in combat (which is what I think the devs are going for.)

Option B) Having multiple marked chests

Why does this make a difference? Well, it makes going for chests more viable as you're less likely to get focus fired, and it reduces the incentive to camp. It also means that any team who is outpost camping is going to be dealing with two ships trying to sell at the same time, rather than one ship. This is going to massively improve the dynamic of outpost camping, as the camper now is at a sort of disadvantage (2v1)



Option C) Give ships points (on a tick) for having the chest on their ship

Lets say that you get the chest. Chances are, you haven't got many points from combat as the players on your ship are frantically running around to fix holes, put out fires, fix masts/capstans/wheels. You are already at a big disadvantage.

But let's say that for every minute that you hold on to the chest, you get 50 points. Hello, now things are interesting. I WANT THAT CHEST. If you manage to get a hold of that chest, and hold it for 10 minutes before selling, you have 500 points for holding on to it. And I think that's fair given that 2-4 other ships will be shooting at you. 500 points is the same as getting 20 hits on other ships, which is what you will probably be getting as a minimum throughout a game in this new high combat world. Even if you don't sell the chest at the end of the game, you have been rewarded for going for the high risk strategy.

If I was to go to the island, I wouldn't go for the chest. I will probably get more points from shooting the ship of a team who went for it. The chest then becomes redundant.
